title: Lxg8956
author: Lxg8956
created_time: October 27, 2022, 03:25:38 PMLast edit: October 27, 2022, 03:35:53 PM by Lxg8956
content: Hello, hope everyone is doing well. Let me explain what happened; 1 hour ago my antminer s9 was mining fine but suddenly, started make odd sounds, so I quickly check the status and found out that the temp of one of the hashing boards was "143ºC" while the other two were 79 and 84ºC. (Here´s the 1rst logs):Code:driver-btm-c5.c:5131:set_frequency: max freq = 662driver-btm-c5.c:4149:ProcessFixFreq: totalRate = 13732, fixed_totalRate = 13500driver-btm-c5.c:9614:init_uart_baud: set counter=53391     Seeing this, i decided to reboot the antminer s9 but, when the reboot finished and the s9 started mining again, i check the status and notice the temp of one of the hashboards is now "15º" while the other two were normal. comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Please edit that to use the code tag #...It takes that text wall and makes it into a much more readable scroll box.  That out of the way, the important bit you left out is: Is the miner hashing correctly? If it does then probably just a bad temp sensor and reported temperature does not matter... If you are at 1/3 lower hash rate the the cold board is not hashing.

comments.author: Lxg8956
comments.body: NotFuzzyWarm, yeah, the s9 is mining at a 2/3 rate (between 9-10 Th). What can I do in that case (one hashboard not working)?
